It's an iconic first-person shooter game that continues to captivate gamers around the world with its intense gameplay and timeless appeal.  From dynamic maps to a variety of weaponry, this Game delivers unmatched excitement and strategic depth.  One of the standout features of this Game is its emphasis on teamwork and communication.  Players must work together to outsmart their opponents, whether it's planting bombs or rescuing hostages.  This fosters a sense of camaraderie and cooperation that few other games can match.  However, VIP mode, which was unique in the CS.16 era, has been removed, perhaps because some players or the community don't like it, you can still play it if you add additional mods.

  The graphics on this game, even by today's standards, hold up very well.  The environments are very detailed, and the character models are very realistic.  Every shot and explosion feels visceral and impactful.  Counter-Strike: Source also offers a dynamic community that guarantees endless replay value.  With so many custom maps, game modes, and player-created mods, the possibilities are nearly endless.  Whether you're a casual player looking for a quick thrill or a competitive player looking to test your skills, there's something for everyone.  With addictive gameplay, stunning visuals, and a thriving community, it's no surprise that this game has stood the test of time.

  PhysX in this game is better than CS2, additional maps and mods on the community server make the game develop and become busy because of the excitement created on the community server.

Recommended to play 4/5

Counter-Strike: Source - Timeless Tactical Shooter Excellence

Rating: ★★★★★

Counter-Strike: Source, developed by Valve Corporation, stands as a timeless classic in the first-person shooter genre, blending intense tactical gameplay with strategic depth to create an enduring multiplayer experience. Originally released in 2004, the game remains relevant and beloved, thanks to its engaging mechanics, competitive community, and the enduring legacy of the Counter-Strike series.

The core of Counter-Strike: Source lies in its straightforward yet profoundly engaging premise – two teams, terrorists and counter-terrorists, face off in objective-based rounds. Whether it's rescuing hostages or planting bombs, the game's focus on strategic team play and skillful shooting has been the hallmark of its success.

One of the standout features of Counter-Strike: Source is the precise gunplay. Weapons have a realistic feel, and mastering recoil patterns becomes a crucial aspect of becoming a skilled player. The game's simplicity in terms of weapon loadouts and equipment fosters a level playing field where victory is determined by skill, strategy, and communication.

The maps in Counter-Strike: Source are iconic, each offering unique challenges and opportunities for both teams. From the narrow streets of de_dust2 to the close-quarters combat of cs_office, the level design is thoughtful and contributes to the game's balance. The emphasis on map control and understanding chokepoints creates a dynamic experience where no match feels the same.

The graphics, even though they may show their age compared to contemporary titles, maintain a certain charm. The simplicity of the visual design doesn't detract from the gameplay, and the optimization allows the game to run smoothly on a wide range of hardware, making it accessible to a broad audience.

Counter-Strike: Source has a robust and passionate community, which has played a significant role in its enduring popularity. Custom maps, game modes, and the introduction of community-created content keep the experience fresh and contribute to the game's longevity.

While the absence of a progression system or unlockable content might be seen as a drawback in the modern era of gaming, Counter-Strike: Source relies on its pure gameplay to keep players hooked. The focus on skill-based competition and the thrill of intense firefights compensate for the lack of cosmetic rewards or character customization.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike: Source remains an exemplar of tactical multiplayer shooters. Its enduring popularity, precise gameplay mechanics, and vibrant community showcase the timeless appeal of a game that has left an indelible mark on the world of competitive gaming. For those seeking a classic and skill-driven multiplayer experience, Counter-Strike: Source is an absolute must-play.

Counter-Strike: Source is an iconic first-person shooter that continues to captivate gamers worldwide with its intense gameplay and timeless appeal. From its dynamic maps to its diverse arsenal of weapons, Counter-Strike: Source delivers unparalleled excitement and strategic depth.

One of the standout features of Counter-Strike: Source is its emphasis on teamwork and communication. Players must work together to outsmart their opponents, whether they're planting bombs or rescuing hostages. This fosters a sense of camaraderie and cooperation that few other games can match.

The game's graphics, even by today's standards, hold up remarkably well. The environments are richly detailed, and the character models are impressively realistic. Every gunshot and explosion feels visceral and impactful, immersing players in the heart-pounding action.

Counter-Strike: Source also boasts a vibrant community that ensures endless replay value. With a multitude of custom maps, game modes, and mods created by players, the possibilities are virtually limitless. Whether you're a casual player looking for quick thrills or a competitive gamer seeking to test your skills, there's something for everyone in Counter-Strike: Source.

Overall, Counter-Strike: Source remains a timeless classic that continues to define the first-person shooter genre. With its addictive gameplay, stunning visuals, and thriving community, it's no wonder that this game has stood the test of time.

Counter-Strike: Source, despite its age, stands as a timeless masterpiece in the realm of first-person shooters, maintaining its reputation as a perfect FPS game that continues to captivate players even years after its initial release. Developed by Valve Corporation, this classic title has stood the test of time, proving that exceptional gameplay and a dedicated community can transcend generations.

At its core, Counter-Strike: Source remains a pinnacle of competitive FPS gaming. The game's simple yet elegant premise pits terrorists against counter-terrorists in intense, round-based scenarios. The emphasis on teamwork, strategic planning, and skillful gunplay is as relevant today as it was upon the game's launch. The well-balanced weapons, each with its distinct characteristics, contribute to the game's enduring appeal, offering a level playing field that rewards player skill above all else.

Visually, Counter-Strike: Source has aged gracefully. The source engine's capabilities, even in its earlier iteration, provide a clean and polished aesthetic. The maps, whether classic or community-created, boast a level of design sophistication that ensures dynamic and engaging gameplay. The game's performance is commendable, allowing for smooth and responsive action even on modern hardware.

What sets Counter-Strike: Source apart is its unrivaled focus on skill-based gameplay. The game demands precision, reflexes, and tactical acumen from players, creating an environment where mastery is rewarded and every match is a learning opportunity. The absence of modern gaming conveniences, such as regenerating health or loadout customization, adds to the purity of the experience, making it a haven for those seeking a genuine and challenging FPS encounter.

The vibrant and dedicated community surrounding Counter-Strike: Source is a testament to its enduring legacy. Active player communities, esports tournaments, and a continuous influx of new content through mods and maps ensure that the game remains vibrant and relevant in the contemporary gaming landscape. The longevity of its popularity is a testament to the game's ability to foster a sense of camaraderie and competition that few titles have achieved.

While other FPS games may boast cutting-edge graphics and innovative mechanics, Counter-Strike: Source remains a beacon of excellence in its genre. Its ability to provide a pure and uncompromising FPS experience has secured its place as a classic, and the fact that it continues to attract players and maintain an active community speaks volumes about its enduring perfection. Counter-Strike: Source is not just a game; it's a testament to the timeless appeal of skill-based, competitive shooting that transcends generations of gaming.

Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, ou simplesmente CS: GO, é um épico atemporal que transcende as fronteiras do mundo virtual, mergulhando os jogadores em um frenesi estratégico de tiroteios táticos e rivalidades eletrizantes. Com gráficos que hipnotizam e mecânicas de jogo refinadas, CS: GO não é apenas um jogo, mas uma experiência imersiva que desafia a mente e a habilidade dos jogadores.

A precisão cirúrgica exigida para triunfar nas partidas eleva o CS: GO a um patamar superior, onde cada movimento, cada escolha tática, e cada disparo conta. A intensidade do jogo é palpável, como um confronto de titãs, onde a comunicação entre os membros da equipe é a chave para a vitória. O trabalho em equipe é mais do que uma estratégia, é uma sinfonia harmoniosa de habilidades individuais se fundindo para formar uma força imparável.

Os mapas meticulosamente projetados servem como palcos para confrontos épicos, proporcionando ambientes variados e desafiadores que demandam adaptação constante. A rivalidade entre terroristas e contra-terroristas cria uma tensão narrativa que eleva a experiência a um nível emocional, onde cada rodada é um capítulo na história em constante evolução.

A comunidade vibrante que se formou ao redor do CS: GO é testemunha do impacto duradouro que o jogo deixou na cultura dos esportes eletrônicos. Torneios globais são arenas onde lendas nascem, e os jogadores tornam-se ícones culturais. CS: GO não é apenas um jogo, é um fenômeno que transcende o digital, conectando pessoas de todas as partes do mundo em uma paixão compartilhada.

Em última análise, CS: GO é mais do que um mero jogo de tiro. É uma celebração da estratégia, habilidade e camaradagem, cativando uma audiência global que continua a ser envolvida pelo fascínio atemporal deste clássico dos jogos eletrônicos. Vasco

Timeless Classic, Still Ruling the FPS Arena
Review:
With 15.0 hours of fragging, strategizing, and pure adrenaline rushes, Counter-Strike: Source continues to prove why it's a timeless classic in the world of FPS gaming.

Likes:
Tactical Gameplay: Counter-Strike: Source's focus on strategic, team-based gameplay is unparalleled. The need for communication and coordination adds a layer of depth that keeps each match feeling intense and rewarding.

Timeless Maps: Iconic maps like de_dust2 and cs_office stand the test of time. The level design strikes a perfect balance between simplicity and complexity, creating memorable battlegrounds.

Responsive Gunplay: The gunplay remains satisfyingly responsive, and the distinct characteristics of each weapon ensure a diverse and skill-centric experience.

Dislikes:
Outdated Graphics: While the core gameplay remains solid, the graphics are starting to show their age. An updated visual overhaul could breathe new life into this classic.

Limited Weapon Variety: Although the weapon selection is solid, a bit more variety could add freshness to the gameplay, especially for long-time players.

Recommendation:
Counter-Strike: Source is a must-play for any FPS enthusiast. Its enduring popularity speaks volumes about the game's impact on the genre. If you appreciate strategic gameplay, teamwork, and the thrill of outsmarting opponents, Counter-Strike: Source is a timeless gem that still holds up today.

Rating: 9/10

The Banach–Tarski paradox is a theorem in set-theoretic geometry, which states the following: Given a solid ball in three-dimensional space, there exists a decomposition of the ball into a finite number of disjoint subsets, which can then be put back together in a different way to yield two identical copies of the original ball. Indeed, the reassembly process involves only moving the pieces around and rotating them without changing their shape. However, the pieces themselves are not "solids" in the usual sense, but infinite scatterings of points. The reconstruction can work with as few as five pieces.

An alternative form of the theorem states that given any two "reasonable" solid objects (such as a small ball and a huge ball), the cut pieces of either one can be reassembled into the other. This is often stated informally as "a pea can be chopped up and reassembled into the Sun" and called the "pea and the Sun paradox".

The theorem is called a paradox because it contradicts basic geometric intuition. "Doubling the ball" by dividing it into parts and moving them around by rotations and translations, without any stretching, bending, or adding new points, seems to be impossible, since all these operations ought, intuitively speaking, to preserve the volume. The intuition that such operations preserve volumes is not mathematically absurd and it is even included in the formal definition of volumes. However, this is not applicable here because in this case it is impossible to define the volumes of the considered subsets. Reassembling them reproduces a set that has a volume, which happens to be different from the volume at the start.

Unlike most theorems in geometry, the mathematical proof of this result depends on the choice of axioms for set theory in a critical way. It can be proven using the axiom of choice, which allows for the construction of non-measurable sets, i.e., collections of points that do not have a volume in the ordinary sense, and whose construction requires an uncountable number of choices.

32 man office servers, the old bhop servers, deathrun, surfs, jailbreak, wc3 mod, rpg, kz maps, zombies, scoutzknivez, pirate wars, soccer, hide'n'seek, minigames. There was once a time where this game along with WoW felt like the Hub of the internet, you'd log on every night and it would be teeming with life, and a good time to be found. When holding snowman with your whole team with a bunch of p90s was all you needed to have a laugh with everyone on the server.

Then this weird game called CS: GO came out. No giant fun servers, matchmaking full of hackers, gamba addicts frothing over skins and cases, people who don't understand what diggity on inferno is....

Call me a boomer man, but CS: GO just did not hit. It ushered in the age of whiny e-sports edgelords and the magic of the game disappeared. We were all terrible as fuck, but man did we have a whole lotta fun.

Avaliação: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Análise:

Counter-Strike: Source é o eterno clássico que continua a atrair os jogadores com sua jogabilidade viciante e ação frenética. Esta versão remasterizada mantém a essência do original, mas traz melhorias visuais e mecânicas que enriquecem a experiência de jogo.

Jogabilidade Icônica:

A fórmula vencedora de Counter-Strike permanece intacta. A jogabilidade competitiva e a dinâmica de equipe são as estrelas deste jogo. A precisão dos tiros, a estratégia de equipe e a tensão dos confrontos tornam cada partida emocionante e imprevisível.

Melhorias Visuais e Desempenho:

Os gráficos atualizados dão um novo fôlego ao jogo sem comprometer a sensação clássica. As texturas melhoradas e os efeitos visuais mais polidos mantêm a familiaridade do mapa, ao mesmo tempo em que proporcionam uma experiência visual mais agradável e moderna.

Comunidade Ativa e Variedade de Modos:

A comunidade de Counter-Strike: Source continua pulsante. A variedade de modos de jogo oferece algo para todos os gostos, desde partidas competitivas até modos casuais mais descontraídos. A diversidade de mapas mantém a experiência sempre fresca e interessante.

Facilidade de Acesso e Longevidade:

A acessibilidade do jogo é um dos seus pontos fortes. É fácil de aprender, mas difícil de dominar, o que garante uma curva de aprendizado empolgante para jogadores novatos e veteranos. A longevidade do jogo é notável, com uma base de jogadores fiel que garante partidas rápidas e emocionantes a qualquer momento.

Conclusão:

Counter-Strike: Source é uma homenagem perfeita ao clássico original, mantendo o seu espírito enquanto traz melhorias significativas. Com sua jogabilidade viciante, comunidade ativa e a adição de melhorias visuais, é uma experiência obrigatória para fãs de FPS e para aqueles que buscam a adrenalina das partidas multiplayer intensas.

Seja para reviver a nostalgia dos velhos tempos ou para mergulhar em um dos maiores clássicos dos jogos de tiro, Counter-Strike: Source continua a ser uma referência no gênero e uma experiência que vale a pena para qualquer jogador.

"Nenhum outro jogo consegue replicar a emoção de uma partida de Counter-Strike: Source."

Counter-Strike: Source stands as a defining title in the FPS genre, offering thrilling gameplay and competitive action that has captivated gamers for years. As an evolution of the original Counter-Strike, CS: Source brought enhanced graphics, refined mechanics, and a fresh coat of polish to the beloved franchise.

What sets CS: Source apart is its balanced and skill-based gameplay. The tight gunplay mechanics, strategic team-based objectives, and iconic maps create an intense and immersive experience that rewards both individual skill and teamwork. The game's simplicity in design allows for a straightforward yet highly competitive gameplay loop, making it accessible to newcomers while maintaining a high skill ceiling for seasoned players.

The diverse arsenal of weapons and the importance of tactics and map knowledge make every match unique and dynamic. The game's thriving community, custom mods, and player-created content have contributed to its enduring popularity, ensuring that there's always something new to explore or experience.

CS: Source's legacy is evident in its influence on competitive gaming and its dedicated player base, which continues to support the game years after its release. It remains a testament to the timeless appeal of a well-crafted FPS experience that values skill, strategy, and precision.

You know, I love the counter-strike series, I really like the uncomplicated dynamic gameplay of cs. But, unfortunately, the game has a disadvantage, because of which there is no desire to play it. No, it's not outdated graphics, it's not the size of the maps, etc. And the community is the community that lives on every public in cs.
These people instead of giving humanely information, instead of covering their teammates (who, by the way, ask them to do so in the voice chat a million times), instead of infesting any point when necessary. People make small talk about anything: prison, girls, how they recently fuсkеd someone, how they recently got drunk, how to fight, how they bought a new car, how they served.

This game reminds me of the USS Panay incident, where on December 12 1937 a Japanese bombing attack on the U.S. Navy river gunboat Panay and three Standard Oil Company tankers on the Yangtze River. Japan and the United States were not at war at the time. The boats were part of the American naval operation called the Yangtze Patrol, which began following the joint British, French, and American victory in The Second Opium War. Public reaction was mixed in the U.S., with the president weighing various diplomatic and military responses only to settle for an apology and compensation. The Japanese claimed that they did not see the U.S. flags painted on the deck of the gunboat. Tokyo officially apologized and paid a cash indemnity. The settlement mollified some of the U.S. anger, and newspapers called the matter closed.

[h1] Counter-Strike: Source - A Modernized Classic that Stands the Test of Time [/h1]

Overview:
Counter-Strike: Source seamlessly blends the iconic teamplay action of Counter-Strike with the cutting-edge Source technology, creating an immersive and visually enhanced gaming experience. With updated visuals, intense gameplay, a diverse map pool, and a thriving community, Counter-Strike: Source has solidified its place as a staple in the FPS genre.

Pros:

Updated Visuals and Immersive Atmosphere: Leveraging the Source engine, Counter-Strike: Source introduces a significant visual overhaul. Enhanced graphics, realistic physics, and improved lighting effects breathe new life into classic maps, delivering a visually satisfying and immersive environment.

Intense and Strategic Gameplay: The core gameplay mechanics that defined Counter-Strike remain intact, offering intense, team-based battles that emphasize strategy, communication, and precise shooting. The balance between weapon types, map layouts, and tactical approaches ensures a dynamic and competitive gaming experience.

Wide Variety of Maps and Game Modes: Counter-Strike: Source boasts a diverse selection of maps catering to various playstyles. From the iconic Dust2 to the tactical complexity of Nuke, the map pool provides a range of environments. Multiple game modes, including bomb defusal and hostage rescue, add variety and depth to the gameplay.

Dedicated Community and Active Multiplayer: The game's dedicated and passionate player base, coupled with Valve's ongoing support, contributes to an active multiplayer scene. Finding matches is seamless, fostering a vibrant and competitive environment that has kept the game alive for years.

Modding and Customization: Inheriting modding capabilities from its predecessor, Counter-Strike: Source allows players to create and install custom maps, skins, and modifications. The extensive modding community enhances replayability and offers a variety of user-generated content, fostering creativity and community engagement.

Conclusion:
Counter-Strike: Source successfully marries the classic Counter-Strike gameplay with modern technology, resulting in a timeless and influential FPS experience. Its updated visuals, immersive atmosphere, intense gameplay, diverse map pool, dedicated community, and modding capabilities collectively contribute to its enduring popularity. Whether you're a veteran or a newcomer, Counter-Strike: Source invites you to partake in thrilling firefights, strategic teamwork, and the enduring legacy of one of the most significant FPS games ever created. Prepare for an exhilarating journey that stands the test of time in the ever-evolving world of first-person shooters.

Updated Visuals and Immersive Atmosphere:
Counter-Strike: Source features a significant visual overhaul compared to its predecessor. The game utilizes the Source engine, which provides enhanced graphics, improved lighting effects, and realistic physics. The updated visuals breathe new life into the iconic maps, creating a more immersive and visually appealing environment. From the detailed weapon models to the atmospheric settings, Counter-Strike: Source delivers a visually satisfying experience.

Intense and Strategic Gameplay:
Counter-Strike: Source retains the core gameplay mechanics that made the series a genre-defining title. The game offers intense, team-based battles between counter-terrorist and terrorist factions. The emphasis on strategy, communication, and precise shooting remains intact, providing a deeply satisfying and competitive experience. The balance between different weapon types, map layouts, and tactical approaches creates a dynamic and ever-evolving gameplay environment.

A Wide Variety of Maps and Game Modes:
Counter-Strike: Source features a diverse selection of maps that cater to different playstyles and strategies. From the iconic Dust2 to the tactical complexity of Nuke, the map pool offers a range of environments that require adaptability and skill. Additionally, the game includes various game modes, including the classic bomb defusal and hostage rescue, providing a variety of gameplay experiences to suit different preferences.

Dedicated Community and Active Multiplayer:
Counter-Strike: Source boasts a dedicated and passionate community of players that have kept the game alive for years. The active multiplayer scene ensures that finding matches and opponents is relatively easy, creating a vibrant and competitive environment. The game's longevity can be attributed to the continuous support from both the player base and Valve, with regular updates and patches that help maintain the balance and address any issues.

Modding and Customization:
Counter-Strike: Source inherits the modding and customization capabilities from its predecessor, allowing players to create and install custom maps, skins, and modifications. This extensive modding community adds tremendous replayability and variety to the game, enabling players to explore new maps, game modes, and visual enhancements. The modding scene also fosters creativity and community engagement, making Counter-Strike: Source a highly customizable experience.
Conclusion:
Counter-Strike: Source successfully modernizes the classic gameplay of the original Counter-Strike, delivering intense and strategic FPS action in a visually enhanced package. With its updated visuals, immersive atmosphere, intense gameplay, diverse map pool, dedicated community, and modding capabilities, Counter-Strike: Source remains a staple in the FPS genre. Whether you're a veteran player or new to the franchise, Counter-Strike: Source offers an exhilarating and competitive experience that has stood the test of time. Prepare to engage in thrilling firefights, coordinate with your team, and experience the timeless appeal of one of the most influential FPS games ever created.

Counter-Strike: Source stands as an impressive successor to the original game, building upon the foundation laid by its predecessor. It successfully carried forward the iconic Counter-Strike gameplay while adding improved graphics and physics, enhancing the overall visual and gameplay experience.
One notable aspect that set Counter-Strike: Source apart from the original was its initial lack of popularity in the competitive ESports scene. Despite its numerous improvements, the game struggled to gain the same level of love and recognition that the original Counter-Strike enjoyed among professional players and competitive leagues. Perhaps it was the result of established players being reluctant to switch to the newer version, or maybe it took time for the competitive community to fully embrace the changes.
Despite these initial challenges, Counter-Strike: Source managed to establish a dedicated player base that kept the game alive and thriving for years. Even to this day, one can easily find servers with active players, allowing enthusiasts to continue enjoying the game's timeless appeal.
What makes Counter-Strike: Source endure is its combination of classic gameplay and updated visuals, which struck a chord with many gamers. The familiar mechanics, team-based objectives, and intense firefights remained intact, providing a sense of nostalgia while still delivering an engaging experience.
Furthermore, the improvements in graphics and physics were significant, enhancing the overall immersion and making the in-game environment more realistic and dynamic. This added a fresh layer of excitement to the gameplay, as players witnessed the impact of their actions more vividly.
Despite its earlier struggles to capture the competitive spotlight, Counter-Strike: Source's enduring player base and continued enjoyment are a testament to its lasting appeal. The game's legacy continues, standing as a worthy entry in the Counter-Strike series and a beloved title for fans of tactical shooters worldwide.

CS:S is probably the best casual experience anyone can get out of the CS franchise. 1.6's casual scene is quite large, but I look towards CS:S as being the best in a casual term. CS:GO is largely focused on comp play, CS2 has not really surfaced a casual or fully comp scene YET, but CS:S had barely had a comp scene when it first released. Due to many bugs of course! Yet, CS:S after all these years were known for having ZE, JB, DM24/7, 18+, and so many other community server types, that all have a different experience! (Most of the time.)

CS:S's casual scene Is quite prevalent within the CS community. Being know for being, err buggy, "bad", and a overall sour taste from launch! 1.6 at the time of Source's release, was obviously better for 1.6's updates and patches. Overtime, most of 1.6 players never even tried CS:S, just because of the 1.6 community's hate towards it. This split the community into 2, Source players, and 1.6 players. 1.6 players were mostly stuck in time with 1.6's nostalgia drug. Yet, CS:S had some things that 1.6 did not have, and in my opinion, made CS:S better than 1.6...

For example: collide-able physics props, recoil not existing for some weapons, flashlights being enabled, client sided mod support, breakable props, early source BHOPPING. The game itself on paper is not too different compared to some early/late iterations, yet the less competitive nature of it, makes for a fun, wacky experience. 1.6 did not have too much to offer, yet it was still a updated CS compared to a Day 1 CS. So, I give them credit there.

CS:S obviously has never had a big impact in the cs comp community. Just being a outsider for most of its lifetime until cs:go. However, CS:S Casual scene still has somewhat of an following, not being majorly drastic, but still alive in some standard. Community is... Chaotic tho, but it's easy to work around, and enjoy the game! Give CS:S a try; oh and valve.

A smoke grenade is a firework that releases a cloud of smoke. They're used for military tactical operations and smoke tests. They can also be fun tools for paintball games and just messing around. Even though using a smoke grenade is legal and safe, exercise caution when smoke inhalation is a risk.


Part 1	
Part 1 of 3:
Preparing Your Materials
Step 1 Gather your ingredients.
1
Gather your ingredients. To make your smoke grenade you will need a few basic ingredients first. It’s best to have your ingredients prepared before you begin to make the process easier along the way. Your ingredients are:
Granulated or cane sugar. You can get this at any supermarket, in the baking aisle.
Potassium nitrate (also known as “saltpetre”). You can get this at any home improvement store or big box store (like Home Depot, Walmart or Bunnings). If you’re not sure what to look for, ask an employee for a stump remover product.[1]
A soda can.
4 to 5 inches of cotton string, for your fuse.
Scotch tape.
A lighter or match.
Step 2 Get your supplies ready.
2
Get your supplies ready. You will also be using several tools to build your grenade. It’s a good idea to have your tools at the ready for when you need them, to make the process move faster. You will need:
Soap and water to clean your can.
A pair of scissors to cut the can in half.
A 1/4 cup measuring cup to measure out your ingredients.
A pot or frying pan to cook your ingredients in.
A towel or oven mitten to shield your hand from the heat.
A spoon, whisk, stick, or another object to mix ingredients.
A stovetop to heat and cook your ingredients on.

Advertisement
Step 3 Prep your ingredients.
3
Prep your ingredients. Prepping your ingredients will help each step go by more smoothly. Being prepared also avoids unnecessary running around or potential accidents in the kitchen.
Before you start mixing and cooking your ingredients, grab your soda can. Clean it out using soap and water. Then, cut it in half using your scissors.
Break up any clumps you see in the potassium nitrate powder. Run it through a sifter if you have to.
Pre-measure out your ingredients. You want to measure about 3 parts potassium nitrate for every 2 parts sugar. That’s ¾ cup of potassium nitrate and ½ cup of sugar total. You can put them in small bowls or containers for now.[2]

Advertisement
Part 2	
Part 2 of 3:
Making Your Smoke Grenade
Step 1 Place an empty pan on the stove and heat it.
1
Place an empty pan on the stove and heat it. Grab your pan and place it on a stovetop burner. Turn the stove on and heat the empty pan over low to medium heat. You’ll add ingredients once the pan is heated.[3]
Step 2 Mix your ingredients.
2
Mix your ingredients. Once the pot has heated up, it’s ready for your ingredients. Since you already have your ingredients measured, all you have to do is pour the potassium nitrate and sugar into the pot.
You can mix your ingredients before pouring them in, or pour them in individually from the presorted containers you kept them in. They don’t need to be poured into the pan in any particular order.
Mix the ingredients together as you’re pouring them into the pan, using a spoon, wire whisk, or some other mixing tool.
Step 3 Cook the mixture.
3
Cook the mixture. Keep mixing until the mixture liquefies, stirring constantly. Make sure you only mix it until it becomes liquefied. If you mix too long the mixture can thicken and catch fire.[4]
Step 4 Pour the liquid into the can.
4
Pour the liquid into the can. Cover your hand in a towel or oven mitten to protect it from the heat. Using that same hand, grab the pot and pour the liquefied solution from the pot into the bottom half of your cut can. You can hold the can with your other hand, or leave it on a flat surface while you pour the liquid into it.
Step 5 Insert the fuse.
5
Insert the fuse. Cut about 4 to 5 inches of cotton string and insert the string into the middle of the liquid, holding in place. You might have to prop the string up by setting your can next to a wall while it cools off and hardens.
Step 6 Let the liquid harden.
6
Let the liquid harden. With the top of the can still off, set the liquid aside so it can harden. This process usually takes about 6 to 8 hours at room temperature. To speed up the process you can put it in the refrigerator for about 4 to 5 hours.
Step 7 Place the top of the can onto the grenade.
7
Place the top of the can onto the grenade. Once the liquid has hardened, grab the top of the can from when you cut it off and place it back onto the grenade, securing the two pieces together with scotch tape. Weave the fuse through the top of the soda can through the mouthpiece.
Step 8 Light the grenade.
8
Light the grenade. Safely light the grenade by taking a lighter or match and lighting the end of your fuse. After several seconds (once the fuse has fully disappeared) you should see the smoke begin to release.
Toss, roll, or otherwise remove the grenade from your hand immediately after lighting it to avoid smoke inhalation.

Advertisement
Part 3	
Part 3 of 3:
Trying Variations
Step 1 Add color.
1
Add color. For colored smoke, just add some powdered (aniline) dye to your mixture. Be sure to use powdered dye, as liquid dye won’t give you vibrancy of color in the smoke. You can get aniline dye at most art or craft stores.
Step 2 Make smoke “bombs.”
2
Make smoke “bombs.” Instead of using a soda can, wait for the liquid mixture to harden a little bit and treat it like cookie dough. When it’s the consistency of cookie dough, spoon it into little balls, wrap the ball in tin foil, and stick a small fuse into the ball.
Step 3 Add baking soda.
3
Add baking soda. Add some baking soda to the mixture immediately after removing it from the stovetop. This will make your grenade burn more evenly and slowly.[5]
For this variation, you will want a ratio of 9 parts potassium nitrate for every six parts sugar for every 1-part baking soda (9:6:1).

Advertisement
Community Q&A
Question
Can I use any baking soda?
Community Answer
Community Answer
Yes. This helps the smoke grenade burn longer and more evenly. But, this is optional if the grenade is only for distraction.
Not Helpful 3Helpful 27
Question
How does the mixture become a liquid?
Community Answer
Community Answer
It's melted, like heating an ice cube. The heat from the oven melts it into a liquid.

Question
Will the smoke grenade melt the plastic bottle?
Community Answer
Community Answer
Yes, the smoke bomb will melt and also explode the bottle.

Counter-Strike: Source, fondly known as CSS amongst enthusiasts, is a game that encapsulates the heart of competitive multiplayer gaming while evoking a sense of nostalgia. Its unique charm resides in its immersive maps and tactical gameplay that promotes team coordination.

When you step into the world of CSS, the remarkable blend of nostalgia mixed with adrenaline-powered action becomes undeniable. The resounding sound of the AWP, the memorable maps like Dust II, and the iconic clashes in Bomb Scenario Mode all contribute to a gaming experience drenched in reminiscence.

One unique feature of CSS is the overarching presence of the Russian community. The game has been thoroughly saturated by our Russian comrades, contributing to a diverse and vibrant multiplayer ambiance. Seamlessly switching between intellectual tactics and raw firepower, they bring a gamut of playing styles to the table, which adds to the flavor and challenges inherent in the game.

Finally, it’s the sheer fun factor that CSS brings, where rounds can turn on a dime, and tactics can be both your best friend and worst enemy. It is a game that not only stood the test of time but also proved that the core essence of fun and competitive, skill-based gameplay couldn’t be watered down. Regardless of how advanced new titles may get, Counter-Strike: Source retains a nostalgic charm that keeps pulling you back, round by round.

鸡烹调法：1、把鸡洗干净，搽盐搁半小时，之后把盐洗掉，再在鸡腹中塞一汤匙盐，少许姜和蒜头。

2、煮沸一锅水，水里放一至二汤匙盐。

3、将整只鸡放进煮开的沸水中，用文火煮10分钟左右，把鸡捞起，滴干水分，再放入沸水中再煮10分钟，把火熄了加盖10分钟捞起，待凉，切块。煮鸡时应不时翻动，以便鸡熟透。

鸡饭煮法：1、把米洗干净，至少搁半小时，饭会比较松软好吃，也比较好煮。

2、爆香蒜头，把白米炒一炒。三、把饭倒进锅里，加入适量鸡汤、盐和香兰叶，一起把饭煮熟。

辣椒酱做法：1、把辣椒，小辣椒（视各人喜好而定），去了皮的蒜头、葱头、姜切片，放进石臼里舂烂。

2、在舂好的辣椒里放入适量的盐，倒入滚烫的鸡汤，最后淋上适量酸柑汁就大功告成。

诀窍：一、鸡最好重两公斤或以上，这样的鸡才够肥，够油分，煮出来的鸡肉和鸡饭才比较香。二、煮鸡时绝不能用大火，否则皮掉肉硬，破坏“吃相”和口感。三、淋辣椒的鸡汤必须滚烫，把辣椒浇熟味道才好。四、做好的辣椒酱应当天吃完，隔夜的辣椒酱味道会比较逊色。

洒上些许芝麻油和酱油，通常佐以一碟酱油、红辣椒和一碗鸡汤 ssibal

Counter-Strike: Source is a remake of Counter-Strike using the Source game engine. As in the original, Counter-Strike: Source pits a team of counter-terrorists against a team of terrorists in a series of rounds. Each round is won either by completing an objective (such as detonating a bomb or rescuing hostages) or by eliminating all members of the enemy team.

Counter-Strike: Source retains its team-based objective-orientated first-person shooter style gameplay. The aim of playing a map is to accomplish a map's objective: defusing the bomb, rescuing all hostages, or killing the entire opposing team. The ultimate goal of the game is to win more rounds than the opposing team. Once players are killed, they do not respawn until the next round, though this depends on which server people play on. This gameplay feature distinguishes Counter-Strike from other first-person shooter games, where players respawn instantly or after a short delay.

Shooting while moving dramatically decreases accuracy, and holding the trigger down to continuously shoot produces severe recoil. The severity of damage induced by weaponry is dependent upon the specific locations of hits, with hits to the head being most lethal and shots which make contact elsewhere causing lesser loss of health. Damage is also affected by the distance a lot, and if the target wears protection. <3

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Back in my day sonnie, we played Counter Strike: Source and GTA San Andreas Multiplayer. Man those were the days, now your lazy generation only buys 2,000 dollar knife and weapon skins in the newest Counter Strike!

Updated Visuals and Immersive Atmosphere:
Counter-Strike: Source features a significant visual overhaul compared to its predecessor. The game utilizes the Source engine, which provides enhanced graphics, improved lighting effects, and realistic physics. The updated visuals breathe new life into the iconic maps, creating a more immersive and visually appealing environment. From the detailed weapon models to the atmospheric settings, Counter-Strike: Source delivers a visually satisfying experience.

Intense and Strategic Gameplay:
Counter-Strike: Source retains the core gameplay mechanics that made the series a genre-defining title. The game offers intense, team-based battles between counter-terrorist and terrorist factions. The emphasis on strategy, communication, and precise shooting remains intact, providing a deeply satisfying and competitive experience. The balance between different weapon types, map layouts, and tactical approaches creates a dynamic and ever-evolving gameplay environment.

A Wide Variety of Maps and Game Modes:
Counter-Strike: Source features a diverse selection of maps that cater to different playstyles and strategies. From the iconic Dust2 to the tactical complexity of Nuke, the map pool offers a range of environments that require adaptability and skill. Additionally, the game includes various game modes, including the classic bomb defusal and hostage rescue, providing a variety of gameplay experiences to suit different preferences.

Dedicated Community and Active Multiplayer:
Counter-Strike: Source boasts a dedicated and passionate community of players that have kept the game alive for years. The active multiplayer scene ensures that finding matches and opponents is relatively easy, creating a vibrant and competitive environment. The game's longevity can be attributed to the continuous support from both the player base and Valve, with regular updates and patches that help maintain the balance and address any issues.

Modding and Customization:
Counter-Strike: Source inherits the modding and customization capabilities from its predecessor, allowing players to create and install custom maps, skins, and modifications. This extensive modding community adds tremendous replayability and variety to the game, enabling players to explore new maps, game modes, and visual enhancements. The modding scene also fosters creativity and community engagement, making Counter-Strike: Source a highly customizable experience.

Conclusion:
Counter-Strike: Source successfully modernizes the classic gameplay of the original Counter-Strike, delivering intense and strategic FPS action in a visually enhanced package. With its updated visuals, immersive atmosphere, intense gameplay, diverse map pool, dedicated community, and modding capabilities, Counter-Strike: Source remains a staple in the FPS genre. Whether you're a veteran player or new to the franchise, Counter-Strike: Source offers an exhilarating and competitive experience that has stood the test of time. Prepare to engage in thrilling firefights, coordinate with your team, and experience the timeless appeal of one of the most influential FPS games ever created.

Counter-Strike: Source, man, it's been this rollercoaster of ups and downs over the years. You can see the dev team's dedication, but there have been those times when updates and improvements were slower than we'd like. The competitive scene, though, it's been a wild ride with those heart-pounding moments and epic rivalries. But, hey, it's not all sunshine and rainbows – balancing and map design have thrown some curveballs.

Now, on the casual side, it offers this accessible gameplay that's great for just kicking back. But, let's be real, there have been moments of toxicity that can totally kill the vibe. So, in the grand scheme of things, Counter-Strike: Source, it's got its place in the gaming hall of fame with its strengths and weaknesses, man. It's earned its spot, no doubt.

There's nothing better than a good mindless drone session on a gun game server. The constant barrage of ear-ringingly loud gunfire going on at all times, non stop. The constant death, spawn, death, spawn, shoot, run, die, spawn, shoot, die, spawn, becomes a rhythm that lulls you into a near comatose state of being, you become an entity that has melded into deeper layers of the universe. One who is unconcerned with death or life, pain or pleasure. You are simply being. Entirely one with the game, it's calling to you. Each w key push into ct side, each super mario sound effect that plays as you mindless press left click, a reward to the deepest parts of your consciousness.
It is so much fun, the graphics great and the maps are all unique and amazing!

A Heart-Wrenching Battle: Counter-Strike: Source on My Ancient, Despair-Inducing Laptop

My lamentable journey with Counter-Strike: Source on my utterly decrepit laptop is a heart-wrenching saga of unrelenting despair. This once-beloved classic has become a cruel reminder of my laptop's pitiable state, and it's a tale that ought to serve as a warning to all who dare tread this melancholic path.

As I booted up Counter-Strike: Source, the grim reality of my laptop's misery was undeniable. It demanded the most brutal sacrifice: the obliteration of every vestige of graphical fidelity. The outcome? A nightmarish, desolate wasteland that bore no relation to the game's past grandeur. Textures, like the fading memories of a lost love, were a fragmented and disfigured mess.

Frames per second? Anaemic and feeble, as if measured in geological eras. Aiming was a lesson in futility, a relentless exercise in despair. Smooth game-play was but a dream, forever out of reach.

In a universe where every split-second decision is crucial, I was condemned to a perpetual state of inferiority. Every engagement was a painful symphony of missed opportunities, every lost firefight a reminder of my utter powerlessness.

Loading screens? They were like a never-ending torment, each one a fresh wound to my wounded spirit. Each loading screen was a tombstone of hope, a reminder that I was tethered to a sinking ship.

In the end, Counter-Strike: Source on my beleaguered laptop was a descent into the abyss of desolation. It left me in the throes of heartache, my aspirations crushed beneath the weight of obsolescence. If you dare to follow in my footsteps, be prepared for a journey devoid of hope. Perhaps it's time to release the past, to let go of nostalgia, and to invest in a future free from the shackles of a laptop that's been forsaken by time and technology. though my craptop was unbelievably bad, it is a fun game. 10/10, maybe someday i can play cs2

Counter-Strike: Source is an updated version of the original Counter-Strike, which started as a Half-Life mod. It's a team-based multiplayer first-person shooter where two teams, terrorists and counter-terrorists, compete in various game modes. These modes include team deathmatch and attack and defend, among others, although we won't delve into the community-created modes in this review.

In team deathmatch, it's a straightforward team-versus-team battle where players don't respawn until the next round, enhancing the game's tactical nature. In attack and defend, terrorists aim to plant explosives in designated areas, while counter-terrorists strive to eliminate the terrorists before they can detonate the explosives.

Counter-Strike: Source boasts impressive graphics for its time, and they still hold up well today. The game's physics are quite realistic, particularly in the default servers. Guns have authentic recoil, and grenades can send bodies flying. Credit for this realism goes to Valve's innovative Source engine, also used in the acclaimed Half-Life 2.

The gameplay is on par with the graphics, offering fluid movement and easy aiming. Each gun has its unique sound and feel, making the experience distinct. Maps are designed to keep players engaged, ensuring you don't wander too long without encountering an opponent, enhancing the game's immersion.

The game's real charm, however, lies in its community. As is typical of multiplayer games, it's the interactions with other players that provide the most fun. Unfortunately, many servers are plagued by negative experiences like rude players, racists, or even young kids with odd character skins. Nonetheless, the game compensates for this with excellent mods, superb gameplay, and reliable servers. In summary, Counter-Strike: Source is a must-play for PC gamers. Overall, it's great. Once upon a time, in the early days of PC gaming, a small group of modders had a crazy idea. They believed in a world where terrorists and counter-terrorists could engage in a battle of wits, reflexes, and all the gunfire you could handle, without leaving the safety of your desk chair. And so, in the late '90s, they gave birth to a phenomenon we now know as Counter-Strike.

The game was, in a way, like your grandma's famous stew - a little bit of this, a dash of that, and a whole lot of secret sauce. It was pure magic, wrapped in pixelated graphics and the occasional "I can't believe you just shot me!" rage. But it was love at first sight for many. You could choose to be a terrorist or a counter-terrorist, wielding all sorts of weapons and striving to complete objectives or eliminate the enemy team.

As the years went by, Counter-Strike evolved, much like your teenage years - it got a little smarter, a bit more mature, and much better at killing terrorists and defusing bombs. There were new maps, new weapons, and, of course, endless arguments about which gun was the best (spoiler: it was always the AWP). It was a mix of strategy, teamwork, and, well, a fair amount of camping in dark corners.

But it was in 2012 when things got a bit more "Global." Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, or CS:GO, burst onto the scene. It was like Counter-Strike had put on a fancy suit, polished its shoes, and gotten a promotion. CS:GO brought better graphics, improved gameplay mechanics, and more matchmaking options. The esports scene exploded, turning the game into a major league of its own. It was like the Super Bowl for gamers, but with fewer commercials and more headshots.

Yet, as time went on, CS:GO started showing its age, like that old sitcom you used to binge-watch in your pajamas. Fans clamored for something new, something fresh, something with a "2" at the end of it. And Valve, the brilliant minds behind Counter-Strike, heard their pleas. Thus, Counter-Strike 2 was born.

The sequel took everything we loved about CS:GO, sprinkled in some futuristic tech, and voilà! It was as if the old dog had learned some new tricks. The graphics were out of this world, and the gameplay was smoother than a jazz solo. But, at its core, it remained the Counter-Strike we all knew and loved.

With the release of Counter-Strike 2, CS:GO was officially retired, a hero riding into the sunset, leaving behind an indelible legacy in the gaming world. It was a bittersweet moment for fans, like saying goodbye to an old friend. But as they loaded up Counter-Strike 2 and heard that familiar "dun dun dun dun" of the menu music, they knew the journey was far from over. Counter-Strike was here to stay, evolving and adapting, just like the gamers who loved it.

So, whether you're a seasoned veteran or a fresh-faced recruit in the world of Counter-Strike, remember that this game isn't just about shooting terrorists and defusing bombs. It's about friendships forged in the heat of battle, memories made in the dust of de_dust2, and countless hours spent wondering why the guy on your team insists on buying a Negev every round. Here's to Counter-Strike, past, present, and future - a game that keeps on giving, just like a good stew recipe that's passed down through the generations.

Years change, people come and go from your life, you gradually grow up and your worldview invariably changes.
Do you remember that very first time when you went to school and cried on the line, because your mother was not next to you and you were very scared? And when your parents signed you up for football, which you hated with every cell of your body, and all just because a strict grandfather did not allow your father to play sports as a child, and now the latter wants to fulfill his own failed dream at your expense?When I tried cheap burnt vodka with the Kents for the first time at school and you vomited for the rest of the evening and you cried and burped your face into the ground and shouted: “Mom, I don’t want to die,” I definitely haven’t forgotten it. When for the first time, at a friend’s appointment, you got hooked with that same uptight, melancholy friend, and she became your first failed love. When you're at the 5th hour of the Lord of the Rings marathon with your new girlfriend, you've gone very far and it was your first time. Graduation from school and admission to university.Master's degree and first well-paid job. Everything that happened in your life...
There is so much time and completely different events, and they all have only one thing in common - this is GAME.
What did you do every evening after school? I watched guides and learned to play. When you quarreled with your father over throwing football, where did you hide from depressive thoughts? When you broke up with that same friend who cut her wrists over breaking up with you,who helped you out and gave you such necessary advice and helped you sort out your own thoughts? The same 30-year-old loser drinking with whom you played parties, who constantly joked that he would be your new stepfather.Life beat you from time to time without a chance for respite, and in moments when you thought that you would not get a diploma and would die of hunger because at the age of 20 you cannot find a way to feed yourself. You always turned to a new batch of young dead-siders, playing with whom depressed you in the moment, but at a distance helped you to distance yourself from your own failures and failures in life, gather your strength, and move on along the winding road called Life.A lot on your path, grief and happiness, everything is tied to an ordinary computer game, which most often gives you only negativity, and yet it always remains at hand to help you get out of the pile of shit into which existence sometimes plunges us. The best game, with a terrible community and stupid developers, but never refuses to help you and gives you so many emotions. This is the Game, and it has always been in your life, ever since you can remember, and staying with you, not letting you go to this day...

A Classic Reimagined

Counter-Strike: Source, released in 2004 by Valve Corporation, stands as a pivotal entry in the iconic Counter-Strike franchise. This game marked a significant shift in the series, transitioning from its original mod roots to a full-fledged standalone title. Counter-Strike: Source managed to bring the classic gameplay of Counter-Strike into the modern era with updated graphics and physics, making it a noteworthy chapter in the franchise's history.

One of the most apparent improvements in Counter-Strike: Source was the visual overhaul. The game made a leap forward with its use of Valve's Source engine, resulting in improved graphics, physics, and ragdoll effects. The upgraded visuals breathed new life into familiar maps, creating a more immersive and visually appealing experience while still retaining the essence of classic Counter-Strike gameplay.

The core gameplay of Counter-Strike remained largely unchanged, preserving the tactical, team-based action that fans had come to love. Players could still choose between terrorists and counter-terrorists, each with their unique weapons and objectives. This familiar formula, rooted in strategy and teamwork, remained as addictive as ever.

Counter-Strike: Source also introduced minor gameplay adjustments, including tweaks to weapon balancing and recoil. These changes added a layer of depth to gunplay, ensuring that player skill and precision were paramount, while also allowing for subtle nuances in weapon handling.

Modding support and custom content played a significant role in the game's longevity. The Steam Workshop integration allowed players to create and share custom maps, skins, and game modes, ensuring a steady stream of fresh content and gameplay variety. This robust community engagement extended the game's lifespan well beyond its initial release.

Despite its many merits, Counter-Strike: Source did face some criticism, primarily related to performance optimization and the transition from the original Counter-Strike. Some players found that the updated graphics came at the cost of reduced performance on older hardware, though this was partially mitigated through subsequent updates.

In conclusion, Counter-Strike: Source successfully modernized the iconic Counter-Strike experience while retaining the core gameplay mechanics that made the franchise a phenomenon. The visual upgrades, gameplay adjustments, and continued community support ensured its enduring popularity among fans of the series. While it may not have completely replaced its predecessor, Counter-Strike: Source carved out its place in the hearts of gamers as a classic reimagined for a new era of online multiplayer shooters.

Title: Counter-Strike: Source - A Masterclass in Milking the Cow

INT. VALVE HQ - DAY

A writer and a producer sit across from each other. The writer is wearing a Counter-Strike t-shirt, while the producer has a dollar sign pendant hanging from his neck.

PRODUCER
(leaning back)
Alright, hit me with the pitch for Counter-Strike: Source!

WRITER
(excited)
So, we take Counter-Strike, right? The beloved classic shooter?

PRODUCER
(raising an eyebrow)
Go on...

WRITER
And we give it a "refreshing" update by... not really changing anything at all. We just update the graphics a bit.

PRODUCER
(nods)
I like where you're going with this. Minimal effort, maximum profit!

WRITER
Exactly! And then, we shut down Counter-Strike: Global Offensive many years later, just like Activision Blizzard did with Overwatch 1. But instead of a true sequel, we force everyone to play "Counter-Strike 2 instead." It's practically the same game, but we'll market it like it's a revelation.

PRODUCER
(laughs)
Genius! Let's call it an "enhanced experience" or something. We're totally not pulling an Activision Blizzard here!

WRITER
(chuckles)
Oh, and here's the best part. We'll add more microtransactions, just like we did with Team Fortress 2 and Dota 2. We'll create a premium matchmaking service and find new and creative ways to exploit players financially. Who cares about gameplay? It's all about the cash, baby!

PRODUCER
(grinning)
I love it! We'll milk those whales for all they're worth!

CUT TO:

INT. GAMING CONVENTION - DAY

The Counter-Strike: GO booth is packed with excited fans. The writer and producer stand proudly in front of it.

WRITER
(excitedly)
And there you have it, Counter-Strike 2 ! It's the same game you love, with a fresh coat of paint and a hefty amount of microtransactions!

PRODUCER
(whispering to writer)
Remember, it's not a scam. It's an "enhanced experience."

The fans cheer and line up to empty their wallets.

CUT TO:

INT. HOLLYWOOD OFFICE - DAY

The writer and producer celebrate their success with champagne.

WRITER
(raising a glass)
To capitalism!

PRODUCER
(laughs)
To capitalism!

FADE OUT:

INT. GAMING CONVENTION - DAY

As the fans continue to pour money into Counter-Strike: Source, a banner above the booth changes to display "Capitalists Win."

And there you have it, folks. Counter-Strike 2, where the only thing more explosive than the in-game bombs is the relentless pursuit of profit. Remember, when you play Counter-Strike 2, it's not about the terrorists or the counter-terrorists – it's about the capitalists winning big!

[b] > be me
> late 2000s
> 3 AM on a school night
> download Counter-Strike: Source
> can't resist the temptation
> mom's gonna kill me
> boot up the game
> instantly greeted by "HEADSHOT!" screams
> already loving it
> pick a server
> "de_dust2 only 24/7"
> like a moth to a flame
> join terrorists
> rush B with team
> "cyka blyat" in voice chat
> oh, the nostalgia
> plant bomb
> start camping in a corner
> hear footsteps
> heart racing
> pee a little
> enemy turns the corner
> we both panic-shoot
> 5 minutes later, still alive
> realize it's just a staring contest
> decide to make friends
> send a "wanna be friends?" message
> enemy types "frend?"
> accept
> he drops me an AK
> feel like I've joined a terrorist support group
> we start talking about life and stuff
> forget about the bomb
> boom
> "round lost"
> back to the staring contest with my new "frend"
> never leave that corner again
> 3 hours later
> mom walks in
> sees me in the corner, still alive
> "I thought I told you to go to bed!"
> "But mom, I can't. I have a friend now."
> she shakes her head and walks away
> CS: Source, the game that gave me my first online friend
> 10/10 would pee in corner again [/b]

Sometimes you need to take a step back and just watch the action unfold. Just ahead, a couple of our guys are holding the corner, stepping out, and just trying to give cover. Oops, make that one guy try to give cover. Our sniper is crouched down, focused entirely on the corridor, waiting for the terrorists to show their faces. All I can hear are sharp, high-pitched squeals, the result of one too many flash-bangs going off next to my ears. We're swimming in fog, stumbling over debris, and picking our way through cadavers and discarded weapons. But just as we're about to charge to the rescue, a corpse flies through the air, arms wheeling, caught in the horrific discharge of multiple frag grenades. Then we just start giggling, and all our clever tactical planning goes to pot. Again.

Years pass, people come and go from your life, you gradually grow up, and your worldview inevitably changes. Remember that very first time you went to school and cried at the assembly because your mom wasn't there and you were very scared? Or when your parents signed you up for soccer, which you hated with every fiber of your being, just because your strict grandfather didn't let your dad play sports as a child, and now the latter wants to fulfill his own failed dream through you? When you and your friends tried cheap bootleg vodka behind the school for the first time and you spent the rest of the evening vomiting and crying, saying "mom, I don't want to die," you definitely haven't forgotten that. When you hooked up with that repressed melancholic girl at a friend's party for the first time, and she became your first failed love. When you went very far with your new girlfriend during a 5-hour Lord of the Rings marathon, and it was your first time. Graduating from high school and entering university. Master's degree and first well-paid job. Everything that was in your life... 

So much time and completely different events, and they are all united by only one thing - it is GAME. 

What did you do every evening after school? Watched guides and learned to play. When you quarreled with your dad over the abandoned soccer ball, where did you hide from depressive thoughts? When you broke up with that same girlfriend who cut her veins because of the breakup with you, who helped you and gave such necessary advice and helped you sort out your own thoughts? That same 30-year-old loser with whom you played party games, who constantly joked that he would be your new stepfather. Life hit you time after time without a chance to rest, and in moments when you thought that you would not get a diploma and die of hunger because at the age of 20 you cannot find a way to feed yourself. You always turned to a new batch of underage insider players, playing with whom oppressed you at the moment, but in the long run helped you distance yourself from your own failures and setbacks in life, gather strength, and move on along the winding road called Life. 

So much on your way, sorrow and happiness, everything is tied to an ordinary computer game, which most often gives you only negative emotions, and nevertheless always remains at hand to help you get out of the pile of crap into which existence sometimes plunges us. The best game, with a terrible community and stupid developers, but never refusing to help you and giving you so many emotions. This is GAME, and it has always been in your life, since you can remember yourself, and remains with you, not letting you go to this day...

Not a bad game on it's own, but it's pretty bad compared to 1.6. Considering this game is supposed to be a "better" version of 1.6, it feels more like a dumbed down version of it. The weapons are really unbalanced (deagle is a fucking beast wtf), the movement is a complete downgrade, the hitboxes are huge. The game just felt "easier" overall when compared to 1.6.

It does feel closer to CS:GO however, and it's probably why many people are coming back to this game after CS2 has released, but CS:GO is just far more polished and balanced for competitive play.

CS:S definitely has better mods and community servers compared to 1.6. It's a great casual game, but a bad competitive game.

This game is relatively great - good maps, great NPC bot interaction, and a few small details that help the game feel more immersive in a way.

What this game lacks in graphics, it makes up for in gameplay. In fact, this can be said about the majority of Valve's earlier games.

The only downside is the difficulty of the bots. The bots sometimes seem like they're on Hard Difficulty, even though they're on Normal Difficulty. It primarily feels this way because of the reaction time of the bots - they just feel too buffed.

The achievements also seem rather ridiculous. In order to get the majority of the achievements, especially the weapons achievements, you must do extremely tedious tasks in a repetitive fashion over and over again, to a point unprecedented in the art of getting achievements. Thus, this is what makes getting achievements in this game very difficult. Even the achievements of other Valve games like (Half-Life 2, Left 4 Dead or CS:GO) are easier to get.

I am a 45 yo mother, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single mother to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game immediately after release. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
Many good times and bad times were had

I wrote a review for the original [i]Counter-Strike[/i], and most of my opinions on that are the same for this game. The gameplay is still good for the most part, so I'll still give this game a thumbs-up.

"BOOM!! HEADSHOT!!" - FPS Doug

Counter-Strike: Source retains its team-based objective-orientated first-person shooter style gameplay. The aim of playing a map is to accomplish a map's objective: defusing the bomb, rescuing all hostages, or killing the entire opposing team. The ultimate goal of the game is to win more rounds than the opposing team. Once players are killed, they do not respawn until the next round, though this depends on which server people play on. This gameplay feature distinguishes Counter-Strike from other first-person shooter games, where players respawn instantly or after a short delay.
Shooting while moving dramatically decreases accuracy, and holding the trigger down to continuously shoot produces severe recoil. The severity of damage induced by weaponry is dependent upon the specific locations of hits, with hits to the head being most lethal and shots which make contact elsewhere causing lesser loss of health. Damage is also affected by the distance, and if the target wears protection.
Counter-Strike: Source was initially released as a beta to members of the Valve Cyber Café Program on August 11, 2004. On August 18, 2004, the beta was released to owners of Counter-Strike: Condition Zero as well as those who had received a Half-Life 2 voucher bundled with some ATI Radeon video cards. The game was included with Half-Life 2 bundles, which were released on November 16, 2004.

On October 11, 2006, Valve released an experimental update entitled Dynamic Weapons Pricing. Under this system, item prices are determined based on their demand the previous week.[8][9][10]

On March 5, 2010, Valve announced the release of games from its first-party library, including games from the Counter-Strike series, for Mac OS X. The ports were slated for release in April 2010. Valve employed Hidden Path Entertainment to provide support on updating Counter-Strike: Source. On May 7, 2010, Valve released an update that includes new features and functionality developed in collaboration with Hidden Path Entertainment. These include 144 (now 146) new achievements, a new domination and revenge system, similar to that of Team Fortress 2, player stats, an upgrade to the Source engine and more. On June 23, 2010, Valve released the beta to the public alongside the promised OS X version. On February 5, 2013, Valve released a port of Counter-Strike: Source for Linux.

Much better then the original Counter Strike on Gold Source. Here is why:

- Game is much easier with better Hitboxes, better Maps and Controls

- Better Graphics and nice Physics, and of course being able to shoot through Walls and Wood and actually killing someone

- Enough Money for actual Equipment

- No real Cheaters/toxic Players. Everybody wants some fun :)

- Source is better then Gold Source, giving CS an still pretty advanced Engine and stable Online Play (never had a lagging Game)

- An more active Playerbase (not really a lot of Players in OG CS)

Negatives:

- Most of the Servers are Custom and so are mostly Team Deathmatch

- Cant add how many Bots I want to have when creating a Server (if you know why and how to fix it write in under this Review in the Comments)

- Germans are still annoying about small things (I am German myself)

- Premium Players on custom Servers who die slow

The core gameplay mechanics that have made Counter-Strike a legendary franchise remain intact in Source. The emphasis on teamwork, precise shooting, and strategic planning shines through in every match. The balance between the two opposing sides – terrorists and counter-terrorists – along with the focus on objectives keeps the gameplay consistently captivating.

The visual upgrade to the Source engine breathes new life into the game. While retaining the iconic maps and gameplay mechanics, the enhanced graphics elevate the experience, offering improved textures, lighting effects, and overall visual fidelity. It's a treat to see classic maps like Dust and Inferno reimagined with a fresh coat of paint.

The tight gunplay and weapon variety that Counter-Strike is known for are still present in Source. Each weapon has a distinct feel, encouraging players to experiment and find the arsenal that suits their playstyle best. The recoil patterns and gun mechanics maintain their authenticity, rewarding players who dedicate time to mastering these nuances.

What's particularly enjoyable about Counter-Strike: Source is its accessibility. The game runs well on a variety of hardware, making it easy for both veterans and newcomers to jump in and enjoy the action. The intuitive controls and straightforward mechanics ensure that you can focus on the thrill of the battle without getting bogged down in complex systems.

Additionally, the modding community for Source continues to thrive. The game's longevity is a testament to the dedicated fan base that creates and shares custom maps, skins, and game modes. This extends the life of the game, offering new experiences and challenges beyond the base content.

Counter-Strike: Source strikes a perfect balance between preserving the classic shooter experience while embracing modern enhancements. Its timeless gameplay, enhanced visuals, and active modding scene ensure that this title remains a cherished gem in the hearts of both old-school Counter-Strike fans and new players alike.

[b] Highly Recommended. [/b]

Counter-Strike: Source (w skrócie CS:S) – taktyczny first-person shooter stworzony przez Valve na silniku graficznym Source, remake gry Counter-Strike. Wersja beta udostępniona została w sierpniu 2004 roku, a premiera właściwej wersji odbyła się 7 października 2004 na platformie Steam. CS:S był jednym z elementów niektórych edycji gry Half-Life 2, a następnie został wydany osobno w zestawie z grami Day of Defeat: Source i Half-Life 2: Deathmatch.

I am a 65 years old father with a teenage son who loves playing video games. I have always struggled to connect with my son as he spends most of his free time playing games online or watching others play on YouTube. As a busy single father, I found it difficult to spend quality time with him.

But recently, my son introduced me to a game called Counter-Strike: Source, and I decided to create a Steam account so we could play together. It had been decades since I last played a video game, so I was quite rusty. But my son patiently taught me how to play and we started bonding over this game.

I was pleasantly surprised by how much fun we had playing together. It was like we were solving a mystery together, laughing and having a great time. Playing video games with my son reminded me of the joy of being a kid and it helped me to connect with my son on a whole new level. We even started spending more time together outside of the game, going on walks and enjoying other activities.

As a single father, it can be difficult to find common ground with my son, but video games have given us a new way to bond and spend quality time together. I am grateful for this opportunity to connect with my son and make lasting memories together.

Step into the thrilling world of Counter-Strike: Source, where precision gunplay, strategic map design, and a passionate community converge to create an unparalleled gaming experience that has stood the test of time.

At the heart of Counter-Strike: Source lies its captivating gameplay mechanics. The precision and responsiveness of gunplay reward players for honing their skills, while the fluid movement mechanics ensure adrenaline-pumping firefights that keep you on the edge of your seat. The satisfaction of landing that perfectly timed headshot or making a clutch play is addictively gratifying, urging players to push their limits and elevate their gameplay.

The allure of Counter-Strike: Source doesn't stop with its gameplay; it lies in the richness of its map design. Each map presents a unique challenge and a host of strategic opportunities for both Counter-Terrorists and Terrorists. From navigating the narrow corridors of Dust2 to the open battlegrounds of Aztec, every environment demands teamwork, communication, and tactical finesse. This aspect of the game cultivates a strong sense of camaraderie among players, creating an unforgettable gaming experience that fosters lasting friendships.

Counter-Strike: Source, the successor to the legendary Half-Life mod, Counter-Strike, has undoubtedly stood the test of time as a true icon in the first-person shooter (FPS) genre. With a seamless blend of tactical gameplay, strategic team dynamics, and adrenaline-pumping action, Counter-Strike: Source has managed to retain its charm and popularity over the years.

The core gameplay of Counter-Strike: Source remains true to its origins, offering a balanced and competitive experience that rewards skill, communication, and teamwork. Players must choose between the Counter-Terrorist and Terrorist factions, each with distinct objectives and weaponry. The tactical gameplay encourages coordination and map knowledge, making each match a unique and thrilling challenge.

One of the standout features of Counter-Strike: Source is its exceptional gunplay. The gun mechanics feel satisfyingly realistic, with each weapon having its own distinct handling and recoil patterns. Mastering the nuances of different firearms adds depth to the gameplay, rewarding players who put time into honing their shooting skills.

The graphics of Counter-Strike: Source, while outdated compared to modern titles, still hold up well and contribute to the game's overall charm. The maps are well-designed and offer a good balance of open spaces and tight corridors, allowing for diverse strategies and tactics.

Furthermore, the game benefits from an active community that continues to create new maps, mods, and custom content, ensuring that there is always something fresh to experience. The plethora of game modes, including classic bomb defusal and hostage rescue, as well as creative custom modes, provides hours of entertainment and replay value.

However, one aspect that may deter some players is the steep learning curve. Newcomers to Counter-Strike: Source may initially find it challenging to compete against experienced veterans. Yet, once players acclimate to the game's mechanics and map layouts, the sense of accomplishment in landing that perfect headshot or pulling off a well-coordinated team strategy is immensely rewarding.

Overall, Counter-Strike: Source remains a quintessential FPS that has aged gracefully. Its engaging gameplay, robust gun mechanics, and active community make it a timeless classic that continues to captivate gamers around the world. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or a newcomer looking for an authentic and intense shooting experience, Counter-Strike: Source is a game that should be in every FPS enthusiast's library.
